page.title: 19The Legend of Giant's Hill.
page.content: {The Story of a Tunnel. In the middle of Sutton wood there is a mound which is very ancient but is definitely man-made. The mound is called Giant's Hill, it is quite big. There is a legend which says a tunnel leads from Giant's Hill to the Old Rectory in Sutton-on-Derwent village.Nobody today knows who is supposed to have made the tunnel or indeed why it was made. Some people think it was an escape route for priests,others that it was made by thieves to steal from the Rectory.There may have been a building,such as a castle or manor house on the mound and the tunnel may have been a secret exit. As all that remains is the mound and the story of the tunnel nobody really knows.
